channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: In a wide-ranging Fox News interview, the US President called Dr Anthony Fauci, the government's top infectious diseases expert, an "alarmist."
item.title: 'It's going to disappear': Trump optimistic despite continued surge in US cases

item.description: Bournemouth’s five-year Premier League residency was left hanging by a thread on Sunday after a 2-0 home defeat to Southampton.
item.title: Relegation looms for Bournemouth after derby loss, Spurs beat Leicester

item.description: Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton won the Hungarian Grand Prix for the eighth time on Sunday to equal Michael Schumacher's single-venue record.
item.title: Hamilton equals Schumacher's Hungarian Grand Prix record

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 20, 2020

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The Federal Court said a “British lad” working in construction for below award wages was legally a contractor but decried the rule that demanded that result.
item.title: 'Defy common sense': Court slams below award wage contractor arrangement

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: About 70 per cent of Australian research is completed by university staff on contracts that are increasingly vulnerable.
item.title: 'Not immune': Universities prepare for more job losses

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Sydney's oldest village needs to be reimagined to draw locals back and fill the vacuum of international tourism amid fears the area is suffering an identity crisis.
item.title: 'Patient on life support': business call to reinvent The Rocks

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: The underworld figure was called in to settle a dispute after two CFMMEU organisers were allegedly assaulted at a Hawthorn East building site.
item.title: Mick Gatto brought in to heal wounds between Setka and Corkman developer

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: St George Illawarra will approach Peter V'Landys and Andrew Abdo about relaxing their position on Jack de Belin, who is set to mark 18 months out of the game.
item.title: Let Jack play: Dragons to ask NRL to review no-fault stand-down policy

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The Rugby Australia board will meet on Monday and New Zealand's Super Rugby invitation is high on the agenda.
item.title: Fair dinkum crossroads: Australia to stand firm on five Super teams

item.description: The risk of coastal erosion at Wamberal and elsewhere is magnified by the impacts of climate change.
item.title: Inertia on climate change fuels coastal erosion risk

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Taxes on all forms of savings would be flat, low and separate from personal income tax under a proposal to help grow the Australian economy.
item.title: Tax savings separately from income: experts back reforms

item.dc:creator: Sean Kelly
item.description: States reopening at different speeds, an economy that can’t be rebuilt by one government alone – the national mood has shifted to gloomy.
item.title: Now for the even grimmer news: it's a hell of a time to be governing

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Audiences are glued to the television during the coronavirus pandemic but cautious advertisers pulled back on spending.
item.title: TV revenue cut by a third despite more people watching

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: As Seven's transformation progresses, a spin-off of West Australian Newspapers looks increasingly likely.
item.title: Seven West newspaper spin-off in the spotlight

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Bank chief executives have backed the government's revamp of a scheme to provide up to $40 billion in taxpayer-backed loans.
item.title: Banks back revamped loan scheme to spark investment

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Communications Minister Paul Fletcher is looking at potential ways to reduce the amount of television spectrum networks use for their services.
item.title: Government chases spectrum efficiency for TV signals

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Labor will do a sweeping membership audit of a western Sydney electorate in the wake of a branch stacking scandal.
item.title: Expulsion amnesty for NSW Labor members with branch stacking proof

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The government has quietly commissioned a consulting firm to reassess how the network is valued, prompting speculation about privatisation.
item.title: NBN valuation under review as $51 billion network enters new era

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: It’s time we stopped debating suppression versus elimination of the coronavirus and got serious.
item.title: The economy can’t fully recover until the virus is gone

item.description: The ACTU president outlines the union movement's plan to rescue Australian industry and jobs from COVID-19 and economic depression.
item.title: We spent big to rebuild after WWII, and we must do it again

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Energy Minister Angus Taylor will review the findings of a four-month probe into Australia's government-owned green bank, the Clean Energy Finance Corporation.
item.title: Minister to review $10bn green energy bank's bias probe

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland Health says testing for COVID-19 is part of its hotel quarantine program but some of those quarantined say they weren't tested even when they asked to be.
item.title: Travellers in Queensland hotel quarantine not tested for COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: The cloud computing ‘mega trend’ tipped to deliver maximum returns as video conferencing and remote working become central to everyday life.
item.title: Venture capital firms bank on a sustained shift to the cloud

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Council opposition leader Jared Cassidy said the council had "blown the perfect opportunity" to install the lanes during the COVID-19 shutdown, when there was minimal traffic on the roads.
item.title: 'Pop-up' bike lanes for Brisbane too slow for quiet lockdown period

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Carol Schwartz has spent the last five months at her "very isolated" rural property on Victoria's surf coast but that hasn't stopped her from keeping a close watch on the governance issues unfolding at AMP.
item.title: Carol Schwartz backs shareholder activism on gender

item.dc:creator: Mark Solomons
item.description: Ipswich City Council has published a trove of financial information but withheld the identities of the councillors responsible. A legal expert says it shows fear of litigation has trumped the public interest.
item.title: Ipswich City Council protecting former councillors 'to avoid being sued'

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Sydneysiders have continued to flock to parks and other public domains since COVID-19 struck, new figures show.
item.title: 'Untapped ideas': Popularity of parks during COVID sparks public space revolution

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Online retail, once deemed "a complete con" by retail veteran Gerry Harvey, is big business now, in part thanks to COVID-19.
item.title: E-commerce pioneers reap the rewards as online retail becomes big business

item.description: After years of "agonising frustration", Australian golfer Greg Norman had won the British open, his first major championship.
item.title: From the Archives, 1986: How Jack gave Greg a grip on the Open

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: A rapidly rising number of NSW police leaving the force sparks concern about loss of experience and morale.
item.title: Police leave force in larger numbers during $583m recruitment drive

item.description: A regular practice can help with depression, chronic pain, anxiety and sleep issues. It's sort of like stretching, but for your mind.
item.title: How to start meditating so that it works for you

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Booksellers might need to shove Malcolm Turnbull’s A Bigger Picture aside on their shelves to make way for a new Turnbull title.
item.title: Book ends: Next Turnbull tome falls far from the tree

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Only 10 per cent of koala habitat cleared in NSW and Queensland between 2012 and 2017 was assessed by the federal government.
item.title: 'Fundamental failure': Environment Department not protecting koala habitat

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: After suffering two strokes and being deemed unable to earn a living, Armindo De Olizeara was living in squalor in a private rooming house. Now he has a fresh start in a new social housing development.
item.title: 'Like a five-star hotel': Homeless find stability in a place of their own

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Victoria needs eight tonnes of quarry material per person every year, but communities are demanding a less environmentally damaging way of producing the materials.
item.title: Resource wars: Communities take a stand against new quarries

item.dc:creator: Shaun Carney
item.description: What we’ve seen in the past few weeks is a revival of the old federalism, complete with state rivalries and barely suppressed enmities.
item.title: A nation divided harks back to the bad old days of the 1970s

item.description: Kicking a state while it's down is infantile and goes against the mantra of our all being in this together.
item.title: Now is not the time for parochial interstate rivalries

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Small employers will be given greater access to a $40 billion loan scheme to help them through the recession when the federal government overhauls its flagship JobKeeper payment this week.
item.title: Loan scheme for smaller employers expanded as JobKeeper undergoes overhaul

item.description: If the government wants to prime the economy with more teachers and mathematicians, there's a better way than punishing humanities students.
item.title: Why the uni fee hike makes no sense

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The cases come after a Sydney father and son, who unknowingly had the virus, dined at Batemans Bay Soldiers Club's bistro on July 13.
item.title: Cluster on the NSW South Coast reaches eight COVID-19 cases

item.description: Of course, there are downsides. However irritating the colleagues, it can get a little lonely being at home day in, day out.
item.title: Pandora's box has been opened: we don't want to go back to the office

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Monday, July 20

item.description: A lovely demonstration of the delights and consolations of art, via O'Brien's visual "music".
item.title: What's on TV: Sunday, July 26

item.description: When all is said and done, zombies are fun, so the more Walking Dead the merrier.
item.title: What's on TV: Saturday, July 25

item.description: Is there anything more compelling than watching an old lady peering intently at genitalia?
item.title: What's on TV: Friday, July 24

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: With three consecutive wins under their belt, West Coast's thumping of Fremantle leaves little doubt Adam Simpson's side is capable of challenging for the flag in 2020.
item.title: Eagles sound warning with crushing Derby win

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: While recreational cycling trails experienced a boost when lockdown started, pedestrians cleared out of the Melbourne CBD.
item.title: Pedestrians clear out of CBD in droves after second lockdown

item.description: A new menace takes control of the river.
item.title: Keep to the left
